schema.description: Region ID. You can call [DescribeRegions](~~DescribeRegions~~) to query the list of regions supported for purchasing cloud phones.

Instance group name.
> 
> - The length of the instance group name should not exceed 30 characters; it must start with uppercase/lowercase letters or Chinese characters, and cannot start with http:// or https://. Only Chinese, English, numbers, colons (:), underscores (_), periods (.), or hyphens (-) are supported.
Number of instances in the instance group. The maximum value is 100.
Duration of the purchased resources, specified by PeriodUnit.
Unit of the duration of the purchased resources.
Instance group specification. You can call [DescribeSpec](~~DescribeSpec~~) to query the specifications supported for purchasing cloud phones.
Whether to automatically pay. The default value is false.
Whether to enable auto-renewal. The default value is false.

Network ID.

- For creating a shared network instance: The network ID is optional. Fill in the network ID of the **Shared Network** type from the [Cloud Phone Console > Network](https://wya.wuying.aliyun.com/network) page. If there is no shared network in the console, you do not need to fill it in, as a shared network will be automatically created when the instance group is created.

- For creating a VPC network instance: The network ID is required. Fill in the network ID of the **VPC Network** type from the [Cloud Phone Console > Network](https://wya.wuying.aliyun.com/network) page. If there is no VPC network in the console, you need to create one first.

VSwitch ID. You can call [DescribeVSwitches](~~448774~~) to query the list of VSwitches.

- For creating a shared network instance: Do not fill in.

- For creating a VPC network instance: The VSwitch ID is required. Select this VSwitch to create the instance.
Policy ID. You can call [ListPolicyGroups](~~ListPolicyGroups~~) to query the list of policies.
Image ID. You can call [DescribeImageList](~~DescribeImageList~~) to query the list of images for cloud phones.
Number of instance groups. The default value is 1, and the maximum value is 100.

Whether to enable GPU acceleration. The default value is false.

- true: Enable.

- false: Disable.

Key pair ID. When creating an instance group, if a valid key pair ID is specified, the key pair will be bound to all instances created successfully, and there is no need to call the binding interface again.

Note: Binding key pairs during scaling is not currently supported.
Used to ensure the idempotence of the request, preventing duplicate submissions. No more than 100 characters.

CreateAndroidInstanceGroup.title: Create Instance Group
CreateAndroidInstanceGroup.description:
<props="china">Before creating a cloud phone instance group, you need to complete real-name authentication. For more details, see [Personal Real-Name Authentication](~~48263~~).</props>

When creating a cloud phone instance group, please note that creating an instance group involves resource billing. It is recommended that you understand the [Billing Method](~~2807121~~) of the cloud phone instance group in advance.

  - If the billing method for the instance group is Subscription (PrePaid), the default value of AutoPay (automatic payment) is false. After calling the interface, you need to go to <props="china">[Alibaba Cloud Costs and Billing](https://usercenter2.aliyun.com/order/list)</props><props="intl">[Alibaba Cloud Costs and Billing](https://usercenter2-intl.aliyun.com/order/list)</props> to manually pay the order.

 - If you need automatic payment, set the value of AutoPay to true.

DescribeAndroidInstanceGroups.summary: Queries the details of an instance group.

schema.description: Instance group name. Supports fuzzy search.
The maximum number of entries per page in a paginated query. The value range is 1 to 100, with a default value of 100.

schema.description:
New name of the instance group.

> 
> - The length of the instance group name should not exceed 30 characters; it must start with a capital/lowercase letter or Chinese character, and cannot begin with http:// or https://. Only supports Chinese, English, numbers, colon (:), underscore (_), period (.), or hyphen (-).

UpgradeAndroidInstanceGroup.summary: Upgrades an instance group. Currently, this operation allows you to only increase the number of instances in an instance group.

schema.description: The number of instances to be added to the instance group.

UpgradeAndroidInstanceGroup.title: UpgradeAndroidInstanceGroup
UpgradeAndroidInstanceGroup.description: Currently, only supports increasing the number of instances in the instance group, i.e., scaling up the instance group.

DeleteAndroidInstanceGroup.title: Delete Instance Group
DeleteAndroidInstanceGroup.description:
Pay-as-you-go instance groups can be deleted directly;

Subscription instance groups can only be deleted after they have expired, meaning that only 'Expired' subscription instance groups are eligible for deletion.

DescribeAndroidInstances.summary: Query the list of Android instances

schema.description: The maximum number of items per page in a paginated query. The value range is 1 to 100, with a default value of 100.
Indicates the current read position. An empty value means starting from the beginning.

Payment type, supporting prepaid and postpaid. Possible values:
- PrePaid: Prepaid
- PostPaid: Postpaid
Region ID. You can call [DescribeRegions](~~DescribeRegions~~) to query the list of regions supported for purchasing cloud phones.

NextToken.description: Indicates the current read position in the response. An empty value means all data has been read.

AndroidInstanceGroupId.description: ID of the instance group to which the instance belongs.

Rate.description: Progress of instance data backup and recovery.

ErrorCode.description: Error reason for instance data backup and recovery failure.

GmtExpired.description: Expiration time for the subscription instance group.

SessionStatus.description:
Session connection status:
- connect: Connected 
- disConnect: Not connected

schema.title: App文件名称
schema.description:
The storage name of the application file in OSS. This parameter, together with `FilePath`, determines a unique OSS address.

> * Please log in to the [Elastic Desktop Service (EDS) Enterprise Edition Console](https://eds.console.aliyun.com/osshelp), and follow the instructions on the page to upload your application files to the EDS App Center, so as to obtain this parameter.
> * If `OssAppUrl` is not provided, then `FileName`+`FilePath` are required parameters.

schema.title: App文件地址
schema.description:
The OSS Bucket storage path of the application file. This parameter, together with `FileName`, determines a unique OSS address.

> * Please log in to the [Elastic Desktop Service (EDS) Enterprise Edition Console](https://eds.console.aliyun.com/osshelp), and follow the instructions on the page to upload your application files to the EDS App Center, so as to obtain this parameter.
> * If `OssAppUrl` is not provided, then `FileName`+`FilePath` are required parameters.

schema.title: App oss地址
schema.description:
The OSS address of the application.

> * Please log in to the [Elastic Desktop Service (EDS) Enterprise Edition Console](https://eds.console.aliyun.com/osshelp), and follow the instructions on the page to upload your application files to the EDS App Center, so as to obtain this parameter.
> * If `FileName`+`FilePath` are not provided, then this parameter is required.
Installation parameters. The default installation parameter is `-r` when installing the application.

CreateApp.title: Create Application
CreateApp.description:
### Preparation

Please log in to the [Elastic Desktop Service (EDS) Enterprise Edition Console](https://eds.console.aliyun.com/osshelp), and follow the instructions on the page to upload your application files to the EDS App Center, so as to obtain the required request parameters for this API (`FileName`+`FilePath` or `OssAppUrl`).

schema.description: The maximum number of items per page in a paginated query. The value range is 1 to 100, with a default value of 10.
Indicates the starting position for reading. If empty, it starts from the beginning.

NextToken.description: Indicates the current read position in the response. An empty value means that all data has been read.

InstanceGroupList.description: List of instance groups where the application is installed.

items.description: Instance group ID where the application is installed.

InstallationStatus.description: The installation/uninstallation status of the application.

PackageName.description: The name of the application package.

schema.description: The name of the key pair. It must be 2 to 128 characters long, consisting of English or Chinese characters. It must start with an uppercase or lowercase letter or a Chinese character, and cannot start with http:// or https://. It can include numbers, colons (:), underscores (_), or hyphens (-).

PrivateKeyBody.description: The private key of the key pair. This is the PEM-encoded PKCS#8 format private key that conforms to the ADB key pair specification.

CreateKeyPair.title: Create ADB Key Pair
CreateKeyPair.description:
In addition to creating a key pair by calling CreateKeyPair, you can also create a key pair using the ADB tool and then upload it (ImportKeyPair) to the Cloud Phone console. The usage is the same as for key pairs created by the system.

Each tenant can have up to 500 key pairs.

schema.description: The maximum number of entries per page for paginated queries. The value range is 1 to 100, with a default value of 10.
Indicates the starting position for reading. If empty, it means starting from the beginning.

NextToken.description: Indicates the position read by the current call. An empty value means that all data has been read.

KeyPairId.description: ID of the ADB key pair.

KeyPairName.description: Name of the ADB key pair.

ModifyKeyPairName.summary: Modifies the name of a key pair.

schema.description: The ID of the ADB key pair.
The name of the ADB key pair.

ModifyKeyPairName.title: Modify ADB Key Pair Name

DeleteKeyPairs.title: Delete ADB Key Pair
DeleteKeyPairs.description:
- If a cloud phone instance is already bound to this ADB key pair, the key pair cannot be deleted.
- After deleting the ADB key pair, it cannot be queried using DescribeKeyPairs.

schema.title: App文件名称
schema.example: This is a backup file description.

schema.description: List of file paths to be backed up.

items.description: Absolute path of the source file directory in the Android system.

schema.description: List of apps to be backed up.

enumValueTitles.OSS: Store backup files in OSS buckets

schema.description:
Domain name of the backup address.

>If uploading to an OSS bucket, call the describeBuckets interface to get the Bucket. If the cloud phone and the bucket are in the same region, obtain the intranetEndpoint field; if they are in different regions, obtain the extranetEndpoint field.

Upload address of the backup file.
> If uploading to an OSS bucket, call the describeBuckets interface to get the bucketName, select ossObjectList to get the key, and concatenate it as “oss://${bucketName}/${key}”.
Whether all data is to be backed up.

Count.description: The total number of entries returned.

BackupFile.title: Create Backup File
BackupFile.description: Currently, only supports saving backup files generated by cloud phones in OSS (Object Storage Service).

enumValueTitles.OSS: Store backup files in OSS buckets

schema.description:
Domain name of the backup address.
> Call the DescribeBuckets interface to get the Bucket. If the cloud phone and the bucket are in the same region, obtain the IntranetEndpoint field; if they are in different regions, obtain the ExtranetEndpoint field.

OSS address for uploading the backup file.
> Call the describeBuckets interface to get the bucketName, select ossObjectList to get the key, and concatenate them into “oss://${bucketName}/${key}”.
Whether all data is to be backed up.

RecoveryFile.title: RecoveryFile
RecoveryFile.description: Currently, only backup files generated by cloud phones and stored in OSS (Object Storage Service) are supported.
